meanings.definition: Having a thin edge or fine point capable of cutting or piercing.
meanings.sent1: The knife had the sharpest blade in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She carefully avoided the sharpest rocks on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The sharpest pencil in the box always mysteriously disappears.
meanings.sent4: Her wit was the sharpest tool in the debate.
meanings.sent5: The sharpest needle in the sewing kit pricked her finger.

meanings.definition: Showing a keen ability to think or understand quickly and accurately.
meanings.sent1: His sharpest student grasped the concept immediately.
meanings.sent2: The detective's sharpest instincts led to the breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent3: The sharpest mind in the room always had a clever solution.
meanings.sent4: Her sharpest observations revealed the truth behind the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The sharpest student in the class aced the exam effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Most intense or severe in degree.
meanings.sent1: The sharpest pain shot through his arm after the fall.
meanings.sent2: The storm brought the sharpest winds we had ever experienced.
meanings.sent3: The sharpest criticism came from an unexpected source.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the sharpest impact on his decision.
meanings.sent5: The sharpest moment of the movie left everyone in shock.
